title: How riot contributes to toxicity
body:
That pregame chat lobby displays text on your client before sending it to server, so its hard to find out who really called what. If riot was serious about reducing toxicity it would be sent to server before being displayed on the user's client.
plz rito

Get someone not competing for the spot. They should easily tell you who called first. It updates on your chat log before sending the post to the lobby, so sometimes it looks like you called first but you actually missed out by a couple of seconds. 

I have had this problem many times and all it takes is a bit of communication to resolve.

Provided that people actually want to communicate. 
All that people do now in Ranked is use Teamspeak or Skype and completely ignore chat.
Then just give up the role to the other person. Be the bigger summoner and play the support or jungle or whatever wasn't called. Do what I do and just don't call or call fill or whatever.

Can't always do that. Some people might actually want that role so that they can practice to carry the game.

I dont think the matchmacking system of ranked and normals are tied together either. I've noticed that I generally get less problems concerning player behaviour in Normals than I do for Ranked matches as well as have better skilled players matched with me, you can't say the two are similar MMR/ELO,
